name: Crystal Lodge Hotel

reviews.text: the suite with the kitchenette is what you want. You have a microwave, sink, small fridge, some small appliances, dishes and cutlery. This is perfectly fine for having breakfast or a light lunch in your room. I accidentally booked a return visit this past March break into a "traditional room". These rooms have not been renovated recently and are quite small. Unfortunately, the rooms with suites were all reserved and we could not upgrade. The rooms with suites are recently renovated and have more room and storage space. Ski storage is now in-house which is a big improvement from before where they rented storage space from the Carleton Lodge. Location of Crystal Lodge is excellent; 2 minute walk to the Whistler base.
reviews.title: get the suite, not the traditional room

reviews.text: This is a well places hotel.I stayed in the hotel part not the suites. It had not been renovated in years. The place is spartan but clean. I had a tiny window and could see the sky and down below the pool. There were 2 double beds definitively tight for 4 adults with ski equipment.
reviews.title: well located hotel in whistler-blackcomb
good experience
reviews.text: The internet was patchy and had to go to the lobby for connection.

reviews.title: Best location in Whistler Village
reviews.text: It is 3 min from the chairs and gondola a plus!

reviews.title: Best skiing ever
reviews.text: Best skiing ever ! We got 2 meters of snow in a week. Crystal hotel was great, large rooms (studio), clean, comfortable, staff was helpful and friendly. Restaurants in Whistler were not the best. Do not recommend the Chinese on 2nd floor, Brew House has great ambiance but prime beef in ale pie not worth it. Will be going back to Whistler for the fabulous skiing, not the restaurants !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location at the heart of Whistler, close to ski gondolas and bars/restaurants. Stayed in suite, which was very roomy with own kitchenette and small balcony with views to Whistler mountain. Staff was very attentive and helpful in every occasion (spa reservations, dinner recommendations, transportation etc). Closest restaurant (Ric's grill) had excellent drinks and tapas snacks that kept us going back.
reviews.title: Hotel with perfect location and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: both the traditional room and suite are good. outdoor pool is not very warm! but hot tub was nice. has a starbucks & handy ski concierge
reviews.title: very central near gondola

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We fancied a long weekend at Whistler and just booked the Crystal through Expedia. It's in a great location right in the village centre and close enough to fall into the gondola on a morning. On the notes there was a hypoallergenic linen option so we ticked it not really expecting anything. How wrong could we be!
reviews.title: Phenomenal service and a great night's sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on Thursday evening. Our skis, poles and snow board were taken away and we were told to park our car and our skis and board would be in the storage room and poles in our bedroom. Super service to start with. The room was fantastic. Split level, home from home, super clean and a great size with our poles in there waiting for us. Even though the room looked out on to one of the main streets in the village and the Telus festival was on it was pretty quiet in there. We met the lady who was cleaning our room in the morning. She checked with us as to what I was allergic to, explained what changes had been made to the room and we talked over the heating and air conditioning. She was just wonderful. Superb service.
reviews.title: Perfect for skiing Blackcomb or Whistler!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coming off the slopes we were met by just awesome members of staff who took our skis/board from us and put them safe into the storage room and who were then there to meet us again in the morning with our skis/board again.
reviews.title: Outstanding all around

reviews.text: The pool was freezing and the hot tub so full of people so we headed to the sauna. Great place to sweat and rest after a full day. Booking with the Crystal you also get discounts with loads of local restaurants and stores including 10% off in Quicksilver making it rude really not to go shopping.
reviews.title: Just Brilliant

reviews.text: The location of the crystal lodge alone is worth the stay. The complimentary ski and boot storage was a treat, often they greated me outside kindly taking my skis and storing them properly until i beckoned for them early the next morning, not to sound gaudy but the awesome service at a great price had me feeling like royalty. The location is so good that you can hop off the mountain head in shower and change and be drinking at the bar before others have found a place to rest their skis. Getting the apres drink quickly was more than pleasing. Not to mention the bars located inside the building. One of the bars within serves a more laid back style, with an entertaining kareoke night, and good spot for us 20 somethings, the second is in Rics which is more up-scale but great service and good tv viewing makes it for a good place to grab awesome food and watch a hockey game (they were also happy to put on the game sound upon request). Not to mention on a busy night there can be a bounty of attractive women. Its hard to complain about a, place this convient especially when its to skiing/boarding and drinking. My only complaint if you can call it that, is the fitness center could use a face lift, it had all the essentials and free weights, which is great but it can be updated in place this nice.
reviews.title: Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And much more. Location: As you can see from the other reviews, the location is perfect as it's on the village doorstep and an easy minute's walk from the gondolas.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: We first stayed in a loft room which overlooked Village stroll pedestrian area and we didn't find it too noisy, in fact we liked the atmosphere of being so close to the village buzz. The room was great but I would be weary staying in it with toddlers who like to climb as the drop from the loft is very high if they decide to climb over the bed headboard.
reviews.title: Great place to stay at good price
Perfect location - couldn't ask for any more.....
reviews.text: We moved to a one bedroom place which was quieter and although it was perfect, we actually preferred the loft room. Both rooms had 2 bathrooms which was a treat for us as we could get ready for skiing at the same time.

reviews.title: No glitches
reviews.text: There are 2 parts to the hotel as the Crystal used to be 2 separate hotels that joined a few years ago. The lodge is the newer part and the hotel is the older part, so you may want to specify where you want to stay when you book.

description: The Crystal Lodge & Suites offers an unbeatable location in Whistler village, with a wide variety of rooms, lofts & suites, shops, restaurants and amenities to suit your every need. Just steps away from both Whistler and Blackcomb gondolas. The Crystal offers the most retail shops and restaurants attached to any one hotel in Whistler. Starbucks, Roots, Lululemon, Cittas, Ric’s Grill and CanSki, to name a few. As a guest you will enjoy the benefits and discounts with our exclusive Crystal Advantage program. In addition to our location, rooms and services, you can also enjoy our heated outdoor pool, hot tub, sauna, fitness room, award winning 4 star service, complimentary wireless internet, heated underground parking, complimentary ski and bike valet. Your perfect whistler experience "at the centre of it all.”
